author: Staff Reporter
text:
The police have registered cases against 24 dyeing unit owners and land owners for operating the units without effluent treatment plants and letting the effluents into River Cauvery and polluting it in Pallipalayam and Komarapalayam.

Warning

Despite warning from the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board (TNPCB) against letting effluents into the river, many units continue to violate the norms. Officials found 12 units each in the two places discharging effluents directly into the river without treatment.

The units were sealed on March 22. Based on a complaint lodged by TNPCB officials in Pallipalayam and Komarapalayam police stations respectively, cases were registered against the unauthorised unit owners and also the land owners for allowing them to operate without permission.

None arrested

Cases were registered under Sections 188 (disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant) and 277 (fouling water of public spring or reservoir) of IPC. However, no arrests were made.

Recently, Komarapalayam police registered case against 19 dyeing unit and land owners for operating without permission. Officials said that the drive will continue.
title: Effluent discharge into river: cases registered against dyeing units
